alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 22 at 6:17PM EDT until April 22 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Wake. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 PM EDT, The heavy rain has ended but rises continue on local creeks and streams over Wake County. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Zebulon, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Knightdale, Wendell, Rolesville, Lake Benson, Lake Wheeler, William B Umstead State Park, Falls Lake Boat Ramp, Purnell, Falls Lake, New Hill and Harris Lake Boat Launch. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
